title: Augmented Reality-Based Critical Digital Literacy and CLIL Integrated Education

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: A social sector job competency enhancement program for working professionals, focusing on cultivating the ability to analyze social issues arising in digital media environments

learning_goals: Learners can critically analyze bias and credibility of digital content using AR technology

Learners select two digital societal issues (e.g., fake news, digital divide) applying CLIL (Content and Language Integrated Learning) methodology and produce a 5-minute bilingual (English/Korean) explanatory video or presentation, achieving an "excellent" grade in at least four of five rubric items.

Learners collaborate with two peers in a blended learning environment applying UDL (Universal Design for Learning) principles to draft a fake news identification framework and identify five given fake news cases with over 80% accuracy.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
